selectSystemEnterValues: First you have to select a system, then enter the values
systemsAvailableQuestion: What kind of systems are available?
systemAvailableQuestionAnswer: We are currently working to add more and more systems to the application. Right now the following systems are working, available:
cookieConsentText: This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.
aboutContent:
This application was created to make easier learning network analysis. Each calculation was implemented from Dr. Sztrik János - Basic Queueing Theory.

Involved in development Zoltán Szilágyi and Szabolcs Szászi. You can find the source code on GitHub.
languageDocumentationDescription: If the language not supported the fallback will be applied which is en
name: Name
featureIdDocumentationDescription: System feature id, which value represented on the x axis
featuresDocumentationDescription: All of the selected system features. Note: X axis feature id should be equal with to
exportToCSVDescription: Select attributes you want to export
tabTypeChangeWarning: Your modification will lost if you change the current scheme.
tabDeleteWarning: You modification will lost if you delete the current scheme.
tableDescription: You can calculate selected system properties based on input values. The result is exportable into different file formats so that you can use it for further work.
chartDescription: You can create figures and compare the system properties with each other. Also, it's useful for demonstrating or learning purposes.
compareTableDescription: You can compare two system properties with each other.
createTablesFirst: Please calculate at least 2 system properties in tables section!
kendallDescription: To describe a queueing system we're using the Kendall's notation, which contains the following:
kendallDescriptionListItems_A: A - Distribution function of the interarrival times
kendallDescriptionListItems_B: B - Distribution function of the service times
kendallDescriptionListItems_K: K - Capacity of the system, the maximum number of customers in the system including the one being serviced
kendallDescriptionListItems_n: n - Population size, number of sources of customers
whatWeOfferDescription: Right now, we can calculate system properties and display it in a table, or visualise with charts. We're working on new ideas, trying to add new features that can help understand the queueing systems
creators:
Szilágyi Zoltán
Csanád Kölcsei

cannotCalculateFinalResult: Couldn't calculate final result so nothing to display
errorOccured: You can get more information by clicking on the red button in the table
